ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Unilateral Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Diagnosed 6 years ago with negative MRI; shows significant progression in high frequencies and WRS over time.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To monitor thresholds and assess stability of hearing loss compared to previous evaluations.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities, particularly given subjective difficulties.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The right ear exhibits a slight sloping to moderate sensorineural hearing loss from 250-3000 Hz, progressing to severe at 4000 Hz and profound at 6000-8000 Hz. The left ear is normal from 250-4000 Hz with a slight high-frequency dip. Results are relatively stable compared to 2 years ago but show significant progression in high frequencies and word recognition decline compared to the original diagnosis 6 years ago.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: slight sloping to moderate SNHL (250-3000 Hz), severe at 4000 Hz, profound at 6000-8000 Hz. Left ear: normal (250-4000 Hz), mild/slight loss at 6000-8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT agrees with PTA (RE 35 dB HL, LE 5 dB HL). WRS is 74% (moderate difficulty) in the right ear and 92% (normal) in the left ear.

proposed_items: Use of Hearing Assistive Technology (HAT) for noisy group settings
counseling_actions: Review test results showing stability over the last 2 years but progression since initial diagnosis
Discuss the decrease in word recognition scores in the right ear
Advise on hearing protection to preserve the left ear

red_flags_present: Significant progression of unilateral sensorineural hearing loss

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for medical clearance and follow-up regarding the progression of hearing loss and changes in WRS since original diagnosis.
